programme.title: Del Potro v Federer 2009
programme.desc: With US Open title number six within reach, the Swiss maestro Roger Federer came up against a young Argentine by the name of Juan Martin del Potro in the final of the 2009 Grand Slam.

programme.title: Stosur v Serena 2011
programme.desc: Sam Stosur fought Serena Williams, a 13-time Grand Slam champion, in the final of the women's singles at the 2011 US Open. Williams hadn't dropped a set in the tournament.

programme.title: Robson v Na 2012
programme.desc: Having defeated a three-time US Open champion in the second round, Great Britain's Laura Robson came up against China's Li Na in the third round of the women's singles at the 2012 US Open.

programme.title: WTA Final: Merida
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Merida Open Akron, a WTA Tour 500 event held in Mexico. (02.03)

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: With the weight of Wimbledon final defeat lifted, Amanda Anisimova enters a last-four clash with the two-time US Open champion Naomi Osaka - her first Grand Slam semi since 2021.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: In the fourth round of the women's singles at the 2025 US Open, Taylor Townsend's dream New York run saw the American take on two-time Grand Slam champion Barbora Krejcikova.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Doha
programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Clinching the fifth of her eight Miami Open titles, Serena Williams would have to overcome one of her great rivals Justine Henin as the pair met in a highly anticipated 2007 final.

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz and last year's runner-up Taylor Fritz, both looking to improve to 2-0, meet in Turin. Alcaraz is two wins away from becoming the year-end world number one. (11.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: Off to a winning WTA Finals start, the year-end world number one Aryna Sabalenka faces Jessica Pegula in a 2024 US Open final rematch. Pegula also got underway in Riyadh with a win. (04.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rouen
programme.desc: In Rouen, top seed Elina Svitolina - entering her first final since January last year - faces Serbia's Olga Danilovic, the third seed, for the title. (20.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Delray Beach
programme.desc: A first tour-level title is within reach for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, as the Spaniard looks to overcome seventh seed Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia in the Delray Beach Open final. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Clinching the fifth of her eight Miami Open titles, Serena Williams would have to overcome one of her great rivals Justine Henin as the pair met in a highly anticipated 2007 final.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: With the weight of Wimbledon final defeat lifted, Amanda Anisimova enters a last-four clash with the two-time US Open champion Naomi Osaka - her first Grand Slam semi since 2021.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: In the fourth round of the women's singles at the 2025 US Open, Taylor Townsend's dream New York run saw the American take on two-time Grand Slam champion Barbora Krejcikova.

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in Dubai. Russia's Mirra Andreeva - the youngest-ever WTA finalist - and Denmark's Clara Tauson face off for glory. (22.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Charleston
programme.desc: Jessica Pegula enters her first Charleston Open final in her eighth appearance at the WTA 500 event, as the top seed faces 2020 Australian Open champion Sofia Kenin. (06.04)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rabat
programme.desc: Maya Joint targets her first WTA Tour singles title as the Australian teenager, who also claimed victory in the Rabat doubles, comes up against unseeded Romanian Jaqueline Cristian. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Buenos Aires
programme.desc: Joao Fonseca's soaring career hits new heights, as the 18-year-old becomes the youngest ATP clay finalist since Carlos Alcaraz when he faces Francisco Cerundolo in Buenos Aires. (16.02)

programme.title: Laver v Roche 1969
programme.desc: In the men's singles final at the 1969 US Open, history was made, as Rod Laver became the only man in the Open Era to win the Calendar Grand Slam - owning all four majors in the same year.

programme.title: Connors v Borg 1976
programme.desc: Home favourite Jimmy Connors fought the number two seed Bjorn Borg in the finale to the men's singles at the 1976 US Open. Borg dispatched champion Manuel Orantes en route to the final.

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Stuttgart
programme.desc: In Stuttgart, world number one Aryna Sabalenka, a three-time runner-up in this competition, meets Jelena Ostapenko for a clash in the final. (21.04)

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Crowned Australian Open champion earlier in the year, sixth seed Madison Keys began her 2025 US Open bid on Arthur Ashe Stadium against Mexican Renata Zaraza.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Two-time US Open champion Venus Williams makes her Flushing Meadows return with an opening-round encounter against the 11th seed Karolina Muchova under the Arthur Ashe lights.

programme.title: ATP Final: Madrid
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper steps on court for the Madrid Open final aiming to lift his second Masters 1000 crown, as the 23-year-old faces 14th seed Casper Ruud for the first time. (04.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a three-hour test of wills, Justine Henin was bidding to close an up-and-down year with the defence of her WTA Finals title against Maria Sharapova in 2007.

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Home hope Lorenzo Musetti enters a high-stakes match-up with seventh seed Alex de Minaur in Turin. After opening-game defeats, the two are looking to avoid an unwanted 0-2 start. (11.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: It's all on the line in a winner-takes-all trilogy match for Iga Swiatek and Amanda Anisimova at the WTA Finals in Riyadh, with the winner advancing to the semi-finals. (05.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: s'Hertogenbosch
programme.desc: Elise Mertens and Elena-Gabriela Ruse contest the 's-Hertogenbosch final. Mertens competes for her first grass-court title having saved an 11 match points in the semi-finals. (15.06)

programme.title: ATP Final: Marseille
programme.desc: After upsetting top seed Daniil Medvedev in the semi-finals, Hamad Medjedovic targets the Open 13 Provence title as the 21-year-old Serb meets reigning champion Ugo Humbert. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a three-hour test of wills, Justine Henin was bidding to close an up-and-down year with the defence of her WTA Finals title against Maria Sharapova in 2007.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Crowned Australian Open champion earlier in the year, sixth seed Madison Keys began her 2025 US Open bid on Arthur Ashe Stadium against Mexican Renata Zaraza.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Two-time US Open champion Venus Williams makes her Flushing Meadows return with an opening-round encounter against the 11th seed Karolina Muchova under the Arthur Ashe lights.

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Strasbourg
programme.desc: Elena Rybakina's first final of the 2025 season arrives in Strasbourg with the top seed taking on Liudmila Samsonova, who boasts a 4-1 lead in the pair's head-to-head record. (24.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Iasi
programme.desc: Entering her first final since 2021, Jill Teichmann faces off against Irina-Camelia Begu in the Iasi final. (20.07)

programme.title: ATP Final: Santiago
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Movistar Chile Open, an ATP Tour 250 event held in Santiago, Chile. (02.03)

programme.title: Austin v Evert 1979
programme.desc: A 16-year-old Tracy Austin became the youngest US Open champion at the 1979 championships after defeating the four-time defending champion Chris Evert.

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1980
programme.desc: With the French Open and Wimbledon secured, Bjorn Borg met defending champion John McEnroe in the men's singles final at the 1980 US Open. Borg was bidding for his first US Open title.

programme.title: ATP Final: Toronto
programme.desc: Ben Shelton features in his first ATP Masters final as the 22-year-old eyes world number six status against Karen Khachanov, who ends a seven-year wait to compete on this stage. (07.08)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Berlin
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Berlin Tennis Open, a WTA 500 grass-court event. (22.06)

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: During his eighth appearance at Flushing Meadows, former British men's number one Cam Norrie's US Open campaign continued against 24-year-old Argentinian Francisco Comesana.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: American Tommy Paul, the 14th seed at Flushing Meadows, entered a third-round contest at the 2025 US Open against an in-form Alexander Bublik on Arthur Ashe.

programme.title: ATP Final: Shanghai
programme.desc: It's a family affair in Shanghai as cousins Valentin Vacherot and Arthur Rinderknech vie for the penultimate Masters 1000 title of 2025. Vacherot stunned Djokovic to get here. (12.10)

programme.title: WTA Final: Montreal
programme.desc: Rising Canadian star Victoria Mboko's miracle Montreal run continues as the 18-year-old meets four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka in her first tour-level final. (07.08)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Adding the Doha title to her successful Australian Open defence, Victoria Azarenka kept Serena Williams at bay as the top two seeds served up a memorable final in 2013.

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Still yet to drop a set at the ATP Finals in Turin, world number two Jannik Sinner faces Alex de Minaur in the semi-finals. The Italian has won all 12 meetings between the pair. (15.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: Unbeaten in Riyadh so far, Elena Rybakina attempts to extend her winning run at the WTA Finals against Jessica Pegula, who's seeking her second championship appearance at the event. (07.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Hamburg
programme.desc: In Hamburg, second seed Lois Boisson and seventh seed Anna Bondar lock horns. With both entering their first-ever Tour final, who will emerge victorious? (20.07)

programme.title: ATP Final: Bucharest
programme.desc: In a first head-to-head meeting of the two, Argentinian top seed Sebastian Baez and Italy's Flavio Cobolli compete for the Bucharest Open title in the final of this ATP 250 event. (06.04)

programme.desc: 5/6. Iasgach a' bhradain air cuid de na h-aibhnichean is lluinne an Alba - cuide ri Neen NicAoidh. An odyssey through Scotland's fishing rivers with Neen MacKay.

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: 8/13. Learner Emily MacDonald chats to Joy in the studio and Calum Maclean takes a wheeled adventure, charting the part Scotland played in the development of the bicycle.

programme.title: An L
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, niseanta is eadar-niseanta gach l cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Rathad Ramsay
programme.desc: 1/4. Ramsay MacMahon walks along the beaches of Barra with Michael Buchanan. Tha Ramsay MacMahon a' coiseachd air trighean Bharraigh le Mcheal Bochanan.

programme.title: Third Lanark
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Glasgow's Third Lanark Athletic Club, exploring its formation and existence, as well as its catastrophic collapse.

programme.title: Trusadh - Saoghal Nuala/Nuala's World
programme.desc: 10/10. Tha Nuala NicDhmhnaill air a bheil autism a' str airson atharrachadh. How Nuala MacDonald, who has autism, is fighting for change.

programme.title: Cuirm@Celtic Connections: Niteworks & The BBC SSO
programme.desc: 2/3. Niteworks and The BBC SSO collaborate in a performance at Glasgow Royal Concert Hall.

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: 13/13. Drama Gidhlig stidhichte ann an Ledhas. Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis.

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: 5/10. The First Linen Bank of Fraochy Bay opens its doors for business as usual and the residents arrive to do their important yet bonkers banking.

programme.title: Alleluia!/Spiritual Music & Verse
programme.desc: 8/12. Iain MacFhionghain le laoidhean, sailm agus sgeulachdan pearsanta mu chreideamh. Iain Mackinnon with psalms, hymns and personal faith stories.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh r bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh r bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: 22/26. Screams are heard from Mrs Tulipe's home... she saw a rat hanging around her house! Is it really a rat or a big mischievous mouse?

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: 5/9. Linda and Dodge the Dog visit Meaban and Moo with a challenge. Today, they must find useful items for a day out with Dodge.

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 39/40. Tha an cel bhon ridio a' crdadh ri Boban - chan eil ri Fiugheag ge-t! Boban loves the music from the radio, but Fuigheag doesn't!

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 40/40. Tha Boban trang a' cur trat air digh 'son co-l-breith Fhuigheig. Ciamar a thid leotha? Boban is busy preparing a treat for Fuigheag's birthday. How will they get on?

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: 8/20. Tha 'n aileag air Goraidh gun stad agus tha e feumach air cobhair bhon Treubh. Goraidh has constant hiccups and needs help from the Farmyard Bunch.

programme.title: Gasta a' Ghraineag/Happy the Hoglet
programme.desc: 15/26. Tha a h-uile neach for mhath air rudeigin - ach d tha Gasta math air? Everyone is very good at something, but what is Gasta good at?

programme.title: Stiridh
programme.desc: 28/82. Cathy NicDhmhnaill a' leughadh Seumas MacTaigeis agus Taibhs Ghlmais. Cathy MacDonald reads Seumas MacTaigeis agus Taibhs Ghlmais, by Linda Strachan.

programme.title: A-null 's a-nall
programme.desc: 7/7. Tha Fumi ag ionndrainn a mthair agus chan eil i idir ag iarraidh cliop. Fumi misses her mum and she definitely doesn't want a haircut.

programme.title: Flix
programme.desc: 12/13. Tha dbhlan aig Flix is Burma - tha aca ri bhith cirdeil ri chile. Flix and Burma have a challenge, they must be friendly with one another.

programme.title: Bogaisean is...
programme.desc: ...Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles. 26/52. Cite bheil an drgon trach? Where is the dump dragon?

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: 7/12. Tha Hannah a' farpais an aghaidh preasantairean CBBC ALBA ach saoil c shoirbhicheas? Hannah competes against the CBBC ALBA presenters, but who will emerge victorious?

programme.title: A' Chil
programme.desc: 6/14. Choirstaidh shows you how to make pretend poo and fake glasses. She also gives you a few pointers on how to draw a great picture of eyes.

programme.title: Dealbhan Fraoich
programme.desc: 5/6. Heather Dewar visits South Uist where she draws a colour portrait of Liam Crouse. Tha Fraoch Nic an Deir an Uibhist a Deas a'danamh dealbh dathte de Liam Crouse.

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: 8/26. Daniel Lennon chats to Joy in the studio about his sporting pastimes and Calum Maclean is in South Uist trying out a new sport in an historic landscape.

programme.title: An L
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, niseanta is eadar-niseanta gach l cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: C Leis Thu? | Padruig to the Rescue
programme.desc: 2/6. Peter meets Scotland's herding dogs - the border and bearded collie.

programme.title: Untold Arctic Wars: The Cold War
programme.desc: 6/6. Deep distrust prevails, and the Cold War situation becomes increasingly volatile. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: Skipinnish aig a' Chaisteal (Shorts)
programme.desc: 2/10. Skipinnish perform Coire Bhreacan in front of thousands of fans at a concert celebrating 25 years of the band, from Edinburgh Castle.

programme.title: Erpa/European Current Affairs
programme.desc: 10/16. Amid calls for the purchase of sex to be banned in Scotland, as it is in Sweden, Annabel Maclennan hears the arguments for and against from those involved in the sex industry.

programme.title: Mach Seo! - An Roinn Erpa
programme.desc: 5/6. Ramsay visits Split for an action-packed holiday in the sunshine. Tha Ramsay a'tadhal air Split airson lithean-saora luma ln sprs sa ghrin.

programme.title: Hebridean Baker - Nordic Islands
programme.desc: 2/4. Coinneach MacLeod explores the food traditions of Bornholm in Denmark. Tha Coinneach MacLeid a' faighinn blasad de chultar a' bhidhe ann am Bornholm san Danmhairg.

programme.title: Binneas - Na Trads
programme.desc: 6/8. Julie Fowlis agus cmhlan-ciil clraichte aig Duaisean nan Trads, 2024. Julie Fowlis and band recorded at the Trad Awards.

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: 11/13. Prof Galbraith looks at the economic and social forces that turned the magnificent conception of the princely city step by step into the modern metropolis.

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: 12/13. Prof JK Galbraith sets out his personal view of democracy. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: 6/6. Fred Dibnah looks at the advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, still used to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations.

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the village of Cromford in Derbyshire.

programme.title: Matthew Bourne's Sleeping Beauty
programme.desc: New Adventures' innovative dance performance recorded live on stage. Set in a world of fairies and vampires, the timeless tale of good v evil is turned upside down.

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rome
programme.desc: Clive James travels to Rome in search of the dolce vita. During his stay, he meets a socialite prince, Mussolini's son and learns a lesson from a sexologist.
